discussion.content: These are really easy and predictable questions. I thought they would be more challenging and touching the actual Dynamics 365 technology. MB-920 has so far disappointed somewhat.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company plans to implement Dynamics 365 Finance as their financial system. The company needs to know which features the system supports.
For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: The given answer is correct.

Selected Answer: BD
These components allow you to define and manage the financial dimensions and account structures necessary for your financial dimension set.

Selected Answer: BC
The Financial dimension sets feature in Dynamics AX 2012 (which is similar in concept to Dynamics 365 Finance) allows users to create financial dimension sets that include:

Financial dimensions (e.g., Department, Cost Center, Business Unit)
The Main Account (which is always included in financial dimension sets)

Selected Answer: BD
In Dynamics 365 Finance, Financial Dimension Sets are used to define reporting structures and enhance financial analysis. The two main components used to create a financial dimension set are

Financial dimensions are categories used to track transactions in more detail beyond just the main account.
Example: Departments, Cost Centers, Business Units, Projects, Locations.
These dimensions help in segregating financial data for better reporting and budgeting.
The Account Structure defines how financial dimensions relate to the Main Account and how they are validated in transactions.
It ensures that only valid combinations of accounts and financial dimensions are used in journal entries.
Example: A company may require all expenses to be recorded with a Department and Cost Center dimension.

B. Financial Dimension
C. Main Account
Correct

questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance.
Which two components can you use to create a financial dimension set?
Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Correct
Correct answer.

HOTSPOT -

//IMG//

A company using Dynamics 365 Finance has determined they have been paying for products they did not receive.
You need to recommend a solution to prevent this from happening in the future.
What should you recommend?

choices.C: Implement Accounts receivable for three-way matching.
choices.A: Implement Accounts payable for three-way matching.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct : A
Correct.
During payment three-way matching is required
correct

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
An organization consisting of several companies is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance. The organization views company and department data by geographical regions and business functions.
You need to recommend organization types for the company based on the requirements.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate organization types to the correct scenarios. Each organization type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Ledgers
If the organization is modeled as a LEGAL ENTITY - Each legal entity requires a ledger that provides a chart of accounts, accounting currency, reporting currency, and fiscal calendar. A balance sheet can be created only for a legal entity. Main accounts, dimensions, account structures, charts of accounts, and account rules can be used by more than one legal entity.

If the organization is modeled as an OPERATING UNIT - An operating unit can't have its own ledger information. If your internal organizations do not require unique ledgers, you can model them as operating units. Ledger information will be set up for the parent legal entity in the hierarchy. Income statements can be created for operating units within a legal entity or for the parent legal entity.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/plan-implement-legal-entities-finance-operations/6-legal-entities-vs-oper-units

Correct : 
Legal Entity
Operating Unit

Answer is correct. 
If the organization is modeled as a legal entity
Each legal entity requires a ledger that provides a chart of accounts, accounting currency, reporting currency, and fiscal calendar. A balance sheet can be created only for a legal entity. Main accounts, dimensions, account structures, charts of accounts, and account rules can be used by more than one legal entity.

If the organization is modeled as an operating unit
An operating unit can't have its own ledger information. If your internal organizations do not require unique ledgers, you can model them as operating units. Ledger information will be set up for the parent legal entity in the hierarchy. Income statements can be created for operating units within a legal entity or for the parent legal entity.


https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/plan-organizational-hierarchy#ledgers
